paragraphs.text:
%md
## Forecasting 2019 Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) outbreak using Exponential Smoothing Algorithm for Time Series Data

#### Oracle Machine Learning supports time series forecasting via the Exponential Smoothing algorithm inside the Oracle Autonomous Database (ADB).  This outbreak forecasting example is based on dataset available here: <https://www.kaggle.com/sudalairajkumar/novel-corona-virus-2019-dataset>.
Updated by February 2020 by Corrado De Bari
Updated August 2019 by Charlie Berger , Dhvani Sheth, Siddesh C Prabhu Dev Ujjni, Mark Hornick, Marcos Arancibia
Copyright (c) 2019 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.
%md

%md

##### 
For more information, check the Oracle ADW Documentation <https://docs.oracle.com/en/cloud/paas/autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud/index.html>
Oracle Machine Learning folder on Oracle on Github <https://github.com/oracle/oracle-db-examples/tree/master/machine-learning>
Oracle Machine Learning web page: <https://www.oracle.com/database/technologies/datawarehouse-bigdata/machine-learning.html>
Introducing Oracle Machine Learning blog post: <https://blogs.oracle.com/datamining/introducing-oracle-machine-learning-sql-notebooks-for-the-oracle-autonomous-data-warehouse-cloud>

paragraphs.title: Create credentials
Clean Dataset table
paragraphs.text:
%script
DROP TABLE cor_train;

paragraphs.title: Create Dataset table
paragraphs.text:
%sql
create table  cor_train (
  Sno NUMBER,
  EventDate_  VARCHAR2(4000),
  Province_State VARCHAR2(4000),
  Country VARCHAR2(4000),
  Last_Update_  VARCHAR2(4000),
  Confirmed NUMBER,
  Deaths NUMBER,
  Recovered NUMBER
);
--Sno,Date,Province/State,Country,Last Update,Confirmed,Deaths,Recovered
--1,1/22/2020 12:00,Anhui,China,1/22/2020 12:00,1.0,0.0,0.0

paragraphs.title: Import Dataset from Object Storage
paragraphs.text:
%script
BEGIN
DBMS_CLOUD.COPY_DATA(
    table_name =>'cor_train',
    credential_name =>'CRED_COR',
    file_uri_list =>'https://objectstorage.oracle.com/n/mytenant/b/bucket-1/o/2019_nCoV_data.csv',
    format => json_object('delimiter' value ',','recorddelimiter' value 'newline', 'skipheaders' value '1','dateformat' value 'MM/DD/YYYY HH:MI','quote' value '"')
 );
END;

--dateformat YYYYMMDD HHMISS 1/31/2020 19:00
--quote

paragraphs.title: Show dataset imported
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * from cor_train

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Dataset Cleaning Section

%sql
UPDATE cor_train
SET EVENTDATE_ = concat( concat(concat(concat( SUBSTR(EVENTDATE_,9,2),'/'),SUBSTR(EVENTDATE_,6,2)),'/'),SUBSTR(EVENTDATE_,1,4) )
WHERE sno >= 498 and sno <=631
--2020-02-02 21:00:00
--M/DD/YYYY

%sql
UPDATE cor_train
SET EVENTDATE_ = concat (SUBSTR(EVENTDATE_,1,7),'20')
WHERE sno >= 39 and sno <=83

%sql
UPDATE cor_train
SET EVENTDATE_ = SUBSTR(EVENTDATE_,1,9)
WHERE sno >= 1 and sno <=38

%sql
UPDATE cor_train
SET EVENTDATE_ = SUBSTR(EVENTDATE_,1,9)
WHERE sno >= 84 and sno <=497

paragraphs.title: Dataset cleaned
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * from cor_train

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select eventdate,sum(CONFIRMED) as Case, sum(DEATHS) as DeathS from cor_train  group by eventdate order by eventdate

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Create final training Dataset
paragraphs.text:
%sql
-- Create input time series
CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW CORONA_CONFIRMED 
       AS SELECT Eventdate, Confirmed 
       FROM cor_train;

paragraphs.title: Drop previous models, model settings and create a new forecast base model (EXSM_SIMPLE) to predict CASES
Review the settings of the forecast model
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- output setting table
SELECT SETTING_NAME, SETTING_VALUE
  FROM USER_MINING_MODEL_SETTINGS
  WHERE MODEL_NAME = UPPER('CORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE')
  ORDER BY SETTING_NAME;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Forecast table
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * from DM$VPCORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Review the model signature of forecast model
paragraphs.text:
%sql

-- get signature
SELECT ATTRIBUTE_NAME, ATTRIBUTE_TYPE
  FROM  USER_MINING_MODEL_ATTRIBUTES
  WHERE MODEL_NAME=UPPER('CORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE')
  ORDER BY attribute_name;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Review the diagnostics and model quality for the forecast model
paragraphs.text:
%sql
-- get global diagnostics
SELECT NAME, 
       NUMERIC_VALUE, 
       STRING_VALUE 
  FROM DM$VGCORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE
  ORDER BY NAME;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Show forcasted CONFIRMED values
paragraphs.text:
%sql
-- To help showing the predictions, use DESC in the ORDER BY statement so that the last points are shown first
-- The predictions of 4 values into the Future of Confirmed Cases has the PREDICTION 
--   with intervals of confidence LOWER and UPPER, and does not have the actual VALUE 
--   (since it would not have happened yet)

Select TO_CHAR(CASE_ID,'YYYY-MON-DD') Day, VALUE CONFIRMED, round(PREDICTION,0) FORECAST_CONFIRMED, round(LOWER,2) LOWER_BOUNDS, round(UPPER,2) UPPER_BOUNDS
  FROM DM$VPCORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE
  ORDER BY CASE_ID ASC;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
## Explore all Exponential Smoothing Models
<https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/19/arpls/DBMS_DATA_MINING.html#GUID-91FC543B-24E4-4D93-9D79-E95B1846F3B7>

paragraphs.title: Setup available model
Drop previous models, model settings and create a new forecast model to predict CASES

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * from CORONA_CONFIRMED_SETTINGS1;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%script
-- Cleanup old model with the same name
BEGIN DBMS_DATA_MINING.DROP_MODEL('CORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE1');
EXCEPTION WHEN OTHERS THEN NULL; END;
/
BEGIN
DBMS_DATA_MINING.CREATE_MODEL(MODEL_NAME => 'CORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE1',
               MINING_FUNCTION     => 'TIME_SERIES',
               DATA_TABLE_NAME     => 'CORONA_CONFIRMED',
               CASE_ID_COLUMN_NAME => 'EVENTDATE',
               TARGET_COLUMN_NAME  => 'CONFIRMED',
               --data_schema_name => 'OUTPUT',
               SETTINGS_TABLE_NAME => 'CORONA_CONFIRMED_SETTINGS1');
END;

paragraphs.title: Loop into all ESM models available collecting Mean Average Error (MAE)
MAE collected to choose proper algorithm
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * from timeseries_algo

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Re-Create a model chosen taking in consideration MAE
paragraphs.text:
%script
BEGIN
 
  DBMS_DATA_MINING.DROP_MODEL('CORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE1');
  
  UPDATE CORONA_CONFIRMED_SETTINGS1
  SET SETTING_VALUE = 'EXSM_HOLT'
  WHERE SETTING_NAME='EXSM_MODEL';
  
  DBMS_DATA_MINING.CREATE_MODEL(MODEL_NAME => 'CORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE1',
               MINING_FUNCTION     => 'TIME_SERIES',
               DATA_TABLE_NAME     => 'CORONA_CONFIRMED',
               CASE_ID_COLUMN_NAME => 'EVENTDATE',
               TARGET_COLUMN_NAME  => 'CONFIRMED',
               --data_schema_name => 'OUTPUT',
               SETTINGS_TABLE_NAME => 'CORONA_CONFIRMED_SETTINGS1');

END;
/

paragraphs.title: EXSM_HOLT: Show forecasted CONFIRMED values
paragraphs.text:
%sql
-- To help showing the predictions, use DESC in the ORDER BY statement so that the last points are shown first
-- The predictions of 8 values into the Future of Confirmed Cases has the PREDICTION 
--   with intervals of confidence LOWER and UPPER, and does not have the actual VALUE 
--   (since it would not have happened yet)

Select TO_CHAR(CASE_ID,'YYYY-MON-DD') Day, VALUE CONFIRMED, round(PREDICTION,0) FORECAST_CONFIRMED, round(LOWER,2) LOWER_BOUNDS, round(UPPER,2) UPPER_BOUNDS
  FROM DM$VPCORONA_CONFIRMED_SAMPLE1
  ORDER BY CASE_ID ASC;
